snippet: A series of classes at the Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club teaches a kind of sex education that goes beyond abstinence and birth control to address what relationships need to be healthy.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column applauds series of classes conducted at Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club, part of Smart Girls/Passport to Manhood curriculum, aimed at helping teenagers navigate their love lives; says classes, which reach beyond birth control education to larger discussions about civility and gender roles, have measurably influenced teens in positive ways.
lead_paragraph: A series of classes at the Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club teaches a kind of sex education that goes beyond abstinence and birth control to address what relationships need to be healthy.

headline.print_headline: Having a Life Before Creating One
headline.seo: Teaching Teenagers to Have a Life Before Creating One
headline.main: Having a Life Before Creating One

keywords.value: Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club
